publications.name: Locality and the Python's Lunch Conjecture
Geometric Surprises in the Python's Lunch Conjecture
publications.summary: We uncovered some exotic properties of an index-1 surface which we did not expect, by borrowing ideas from Almgren-Pitts min-max theory.

publications.name: Quasinormal Modes of Black Holes
publications.summary: This is an introductory and accessible article on Quasinormal modes of a black hole.

projects.name: Tensor Network Analysis of Python’s Lunch Conjecture
projects.summary: Collaborated on tensor-network approaches to black-hole interior reconstruction, investigating how newly identified bulge-surface geometry affects algorithms and providing evidence for faster information extraction.
highlights: Statistical analysis of non-isometricity in TNs
Cross-team collaboration (Headrick, Lawrence, Sasieta, Swingle, Wolfe)

projects.name: Geometrical Analysis of Python’s Lunch Conjecture
projects.summary: Analyzed time complexity for interior reconstruction and developed a mathematical framework for the bulge surface; solved PDE eigenvalue problems in multiple geometries with implications for tensor networks.

projects.name: Entanglement Entropy in Field Theories (Bachelor’s Thesis)
projects.summary: Reviewed entanglement entropy in the 2D AKLT model, the replica trick for 2D CFTs, and the quantum Hall effect via Chern–Simons theory; integrated methods across lattice models and continuum field theory.

projects.name: Supersymmetric Path Integrals and the Index Theorems
projects.summary: Studied 0+1D supersymmetry and superspace; rederived Gauss–Bonnet and Hirzebruch signature results; reproduced the Dirac index leading to the Atiyah–Singer index theorem; explored localization for SUSY path integrals.

projects.name: Quasinormal Modes of Black Holes
projects.summary: Analyzed ringdown behavior using analytic methods for Schwarzschild and Reissner–Nordström black holes and extended the study to f(R) gravity; later published an accessible overview.

projects.name: Cosmic Microwave Background Detection
projects.summary: Worked with the KUMODeS II receiver (KEK) to detect atmospheric water vapor and CMB signatures; explored adapting CMB-detection techniques for weather forecasting with Python-based analysis and modeling.

projects.name: Analysis of Dwarf Spheroidal Galaxies for Dark Matter Signal
projects.summary: Processed Fermi-LAT GeV data on an HPC cluster; modeled fluxes using CLUMPY J-factors and density profiles; used HEALPix masking and χ² fits to estimate NFW parameters.
